News.Title: Updater Services Reports Mixed Q2 Performance with IFM Growth Offset by BSS Challenges
News.Summary: Updater Services Limited reported quarterly results with contrasting performance across segments. The Integrated Facilities Management (IFM) business recorded 10% year-on-year revenue growth to INR 9,608 million in H1 FY26, adding 14 new clients during the quarter. However, EBITDA stood at INR 476 million with margins impacted by upfront costs from new strategic contracts still in ramp-up phase. The Business Support Services (BSS) segment faced headwinds, with overall BSS growth at just 1.5% year-on-year. Key challenges included sluggish demand from a large global customer in Denave's demand generation segment, continued IT hiring slowdown affecting the employee background verification business, and a 20% decline in Athena revenues. The company took conservative provisions of INR 30 million related to receivables under review at subsidiary Avon, primarily due to lapses in due diligence processes. Management expects consolidated revenue growth of 9-10% for the full year, targeting 12-13% growth in IFM and around 3-4% in BSS. The company maintains its focus on private sector clients and technology-led interventions to improve profitability.

News.Title: Updater Services Reports No Deviation in IPO Fund Utilization for Q2 FY2026
News.Summary: Updater Services Limited submitted its monitoring agency report for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, prepared by ICRA Limited. The report confirms no deviation from the stated objects of the company's IPO issue, with fund utilization aligned with disclosed purposes. The company's IPO raised Rs 640 crores, with net proceeds of Rs 377.87 crores allocated across four main objectives: repayment of borrowings (Rs 133 crores), working capital funding (Rs 115 crores), inorganic initiatives (Rs 80 crores), and general corporate purposes (Rs 49.87 crores). As of the quarter end, Rs 377.76 crores had been utilized with Rs 0.11 crores remaining unutilized. All implementation timelines remain on schedule with completion dates set for March 31, 2025. The monitoring agency found no major deviations, delays, or unfavorable events affecting the viability of the stated objects.

News.Title: Updater Services Reports 7% Revenue Decline in Q2FY26 Despite Strategic Contract Wins
News.Summary: Updater Services Limited reported consolidated revenue of ₹7,349 million for Q2FY26, down 7% from ₹7,869 million in Q2FY25. EBITDA increased to ₹506 million from ₹371 million year-over-year, with margins improving to 7.4% from 5.0%. For H1FY26, revenue declined 7% to ₹14,402 million while EBITDA fell 17% to ₹815 million. The company secured several strategic contracts during the quarter that are in ramp-up phase with upfront costs impacting margins. BSS companies Denave and Athena experienced impact from global industry headwinds. UDS Group added 28 marquee clients across business segments and received Great Place to Work accreditation for the third consecutive year. The company anticipates full-year FY26 revenue growth in the 0-10% range. During internal review of Avon subsidiary, certain instances were identified where thorough due diligence processes for customers were not adequately completed.

News.Title: Updater Services Reports Mixed Q2 Results with Revenue Growth but Profit Decline
News.Summary: Updater Services reported Q2 consolidated net profit of 199 million rupees, down from 281 million rupees in the same period last year. Revenue increased to 7.3 billion rupees compared to 6.8 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA declined to 316 million rupees from 438 million rupees, while EBITDA margin compressed to 4.33% from 6.44% in the previous year.

News.Title: Updater Services Identifies Irregularities Worth INR 280 Million in Subsidiary Operations
News.Summary: Updater Services Limited has identified potential irregularities in its subsidiary Avon Solutions Logistics Private Limited involving trade receivables of INR 280 million and trade payables of INR 50 million as of September 30, 2025. The irregularities involve transactions related to sales to certain customers and services procured from certain vendors. The company has recorded a provision for doubtful recovery of INR 30 million against these trade receivables in its unaudited consolidated financial results. Management is initiating an investigation to evaluate the irregularities and determine necessary actions. The company stated it cannot evaluate the likely outcome or consequential impact on financial results pending completion of the investigation.

News.Title: Updater Services Reports 7% Revenue Growth to INR 7,053 Million in Q1 FY26 Despite Global Headwinds
News.Summary: Updater Services Limited reported quarterly revenue of INR 7,053 million, representing 7% year-on-year growth. The company achieved EBITDA of INR 444 million with margins of 6.3% and PAT of INR 290 million, showing 13% growth. The IFM segment contributed 66% of revenue with INR 4,679 million (10% growth), while BSS segment accounted for 34% with INR 2,374 million. The company added 5 new logos in IFM and 9 in BSS, with total headcount reaching 73,000 employees (9% growth). Global uncertainties and geopolitical instability impacted discretionary spending, particularly affecting IT sector demand and background verification services. The company faced challenges including client in-sourcing at Athena, IT industry slowdowns affecting employee background verification, and cautious corporate spending in sales enablement services. Management expects 13-15% revenue growth in IFM segment and maintains confidence in 15% PAT growth for the full year despite sector-specific headwinds. The company holds INR 250 crores in cash with negative 0.2x net debt to equity ratio.

News.Title: Updater Services Limited Reports No Deviation in IPO Proceeds Utilization for Q1 FY2026
News.Summary: Updater Services Limited submitted a monitoring agency report through ICRA Limited for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, regarding the utilization of proceeds from their Initial Public Offer. The company raised INR 640 crores through its IPO in September 2023, with net proceeds of INR 377.87 crores allocated for specific purposes. The monitoring report shows no deviation from the stated objects of the issue. The company has fully utilized INR 377.76 crores across four key areas: INR 133 crores for repayment of borrowings, INR 115 crores for working capital requirements, INR 80 crores for inorganic initiatives, and INR 49.76 crores for general corporate purposes. Only INR 0.11 crores remains unutilized. ICRA Limited confirmed that the utilization is in line with the objects of the issue and all completion targets were met on schedule by March 31, 2025. The company operates in the manpower outsourcing and security services sector.

News.Title: Updater Services CFO Radha Ramanujan Resigns; Company Reports Q1 Consolidated Profit of ₹289.88 Million

Price & Co. as Internal Auditor for the period from April 1, 2025, to June 30, 2025. The Board approved standalone and consolidated unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company reported consolidated revenue from operations of ₹7,002.41 million and profit after tax of ₹289.88 million for the quarter. Standalone results showed revenue from operations of ₹4,160.87 million and profit after tax of ₹156.23 million. The company operates through two segments: Integrated Facility Management Services and Business Support Services. Basic earnings per share stood at ₹4.33 for consolidated results and ₹2.33 for standalone results.
